meanings.definition: To design something better than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outdesign her classmates in art projects.
meanings.sent2: The new architect was able to outdesign the competition with her innovative ideas.
meanings.sent3: The rivalry between the two designers led them to constantly try to outdesign each other.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity knew no bounds as she outdesigned everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: In the world of fashion, it is essential to outdesign your competitors to stay ahead.

meanings.sent1: The young designer managed to outdesign the experienced professionals in the industry.
meanings.sent2: His unique approach to architecture allowed him to outdesign all his peers.
meanings.sent3: The race car was so fast, it seemed to outdesign the laws of physics.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for interior design enabled her to outdesign even the most renowned decorators.
meanings.sent5: The futuristic building seemed to outdesign anything seen before in the city.

meanings.sent1: The company aimed to outdesign their competitors by introducing cutting-edge technology.
meanings.sent2: The young artist's work never failed to outdesign the traditional paintings in the gallery.
meanings.sent3: The cake decorator managed to outdesign all previous creations with her latest masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: His ability to outdesign others in the field made him a sought-after designer.
meanings.sent5: The new software outdesigned all existing programs with its user-friendly interface.
